caption: Amazing food and spectacular service! Also great options for keto and gluten free!!
Wonderful pizza.i can eat here everyday! Love everything on da menu
Very nice establishment. Friendly staff.
Incredible food, great location, and a cool atmosphere. My favorite restaurant in Boise.
Maybe don't allow reservations on days you're closed. Showed up very ready for a good meal and it was closed...
We had a fantastic family dinner. The food was great. The service was amazing, Summer is a true professional. She constantly was checking on us and taking care of us.
Great pizza! Great service! The owner was very friendly and personal.  Absolutely loved the interior design of the restaurant. We'll definitely be back!
Took my niece out for lunch. They were able to come up with a sandwich that she really enjoyed (she doesn't like many things) and the salad I had was delicious! Would very much recommend this place.

I never leave bad reviews, and I even feel bad leaving this one, but if you're thinking about ordering through Uber eats, don't do it. The bread was so cold, hard and stale. We literally couldn't eat it. They charged us for a bowl of soup and we opened the container and it was about three tablespoons worth. I think the quality is much better if you're there in person, I've never had an issue dining at this restaurant. But I'm very disappointed in this meal.
Fabulous food and great service! Love the vibe

If you are looking for delicious upscale pizzeria that complements the downtown ambiance, then look no further. The staff is top-notch. The view solidifies this pizzeria is upscale, but enough about the staff and view. The food is what we are here for and it is simply refreshing, light, and flavorful - everything you want pizzeria with great drinks, but is extremely affordable. Will be coming back soon.

3 of us went here in late June during a COVID surge and they were taking it seriously. Masks, spaced tables, hella sanitation, and all with friendly faces and attitudes.  Aside from that, the food was great, and the place was impeccably clean. Only complaint would be the bottom of the dough had pockets of flour and corn meal, making that bite start out kinda weird.

Went there on a Wednesday without any reservations. The interior design is nice and the the staff were great. We had a seat by the Open Glass where you can see the 8th Street. The most attracting thing about this place you can see the pizza oven at the center of the restaurant. We had two pizzas and the taste were great.
Great food, fun atmosphere and delicious drinks! Each location is super unique too!
It's kind of rude to hang up on people.

We absolutely loved the vibe of this place! Our waiter was very friendly and quick. We ordered the Alfredo chicken pizza and it was truly delicious!! I'd say my only minor complaint was that it was super loud but it was also a Friday night and again I don't think it's meant to be a quiet sit down necessarily. Would go again!
Had a good lunch. A bit noisy but otherwise very good.
Really tasty pizza, perfect combo with a cold porter beer. Nice ambience as well.
The pizza is great, pasta is delicious and the service was wonderful!

We’ve being going to your restaurant before you moved into the Zion building and have never had a bad experience. When friends come into town, it’s the first place we think of when dining out for dinner. There are many good choices in downtown Boise and have always considered you as one of them...until last night. I’m not sure if there is new management or maybe a new cook, but when all three of our meals are not close to being the standard of what we have come to expect from Flatbread, then something is wrong. I had the Rosemary Chicken sandwich which is normally an extremely tasty sandwich that I always order. Last night it was very dry and unpleasantly tasteless. I did eat half of it because I was hungry. My sister-in-law had the Alfredo the Grate. It was cold and dry and had no bacon and only two pieces of artichoke. My wife had the Chicken Parmigiana which was overcooked and very greasy. The one bright spot was the Wood-Roasted Cauliflower appetizer. Overall, it was a bad experience that makes choosing Flatbread the next time we dine-out not one of our options.
Great lunch special ( tomato margherita pizza & chopped kale salad) good atmosphere for group lunch or dinner!
This place is great. Perfect if your looking for good food and drinks with a beautiful atmosphere and not too crowded.
Always a favorite for pizza and Italian food

Great food, great atmosphere and great staff. Service was terrific and everyone was very friendly. I did the pick two combo and the tomato soup was super tasty with great spices. Would definitely come here again!
Super friendly staff, pretty decent food

This place is so freaking awesome. For starters the food was delicious. My favorite and biggest recommendation is the fire roasted goat cheese - OH MY GOD this was so good I wanted to order another plate if we didn’t have pizza on the way. The pizza was A+ as well. Staff was super friendly and were super quick with the drinks. can’t wait to bring my fiancé and other people here. I recommend calling ahead for reservations, especially if you want a cool window seat. The bar is cool too tho 😎🥃🍸🍹🍾🍷🥂  UPDATE 12/30/2019: Capricciosa - Fior di Latte, San Marzano Pomodoro, Creminelli Prosciutto Crudo, Fresh Basil, Artichoke Hearts, Herbed Portobello Mushrooms, Kalamata Olives ⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀⠀ I absolutely LOVE Flatbread Neapolitan! Their food never fails to make me happy. I usually get the Margherita pizza, but I decided to branch out this time and try something new. I haven’t had much experience with carpaccio, so I was a little anxious, but that changed when I had my first bite. The carpaccio was delicious, and all the ingredients and toppings on this pizza mixed in together so well. 10/10 as always. They have some delicious drinks as well!
One of my favorite places to eat in Boise! Everything is delicious!
Good food for average prices.
Always delicious but the bar needs to make sure they have enough garnishthey couldn't do the jalapeno margarita because they had no jalapenos and my old fashioned they did not have a cherry
(Translated by Google) Good food  (Original) Guten essen
Good lunch spot.  Friendly staff, prompt service, good pick two
I love the Sicilian Margarita! It's a blood orange margarita and is Delish!
This is one of my go to places. If you like Mac and cheese I am convinced theirs is the best in town
Great food and atmosphere.
Drinks here are wonderful. Bar staff is awesome.

The lunch specials are where it's at. (Otherwise, I find it too expensive for the portion sizes.) I love the vibe at this location and the servers are always attentive, which makes it a feasible lunch spot on a work day. Their blood orange vinaigrette is the bees knees!
Good fun, but they forgot about us in the lobby so we had a very long wait.
Good pizza. Look for their happy hour drink specials and once a week discount pizza sale.

They changed their Happy Hour from 50% to 30%, without mentioning it when we ordered drinks from the happy hour menu. A group of myself and friends go on Fridays/Saturdays for any home BSU games. We have the drink menu memorized at this point. Their table advertisements still show 50% happy hour pricing.  Got our bill tonight. Only 3 drinks were discounted at 30%, everything else was full price. Asked to speak to the manager who informed me " Sorry we changed our happy hour pricing and the table advertisements are old but we already charged your card, there isn't anything I can do. Thanks for coming"  ...  Was a great happy hour spot for locals to avoid crazy downtown, but with service like that, no thank you.
Overall good food and atmosphere. I prefer the pizza here.
Good beer. Good pizza. Good atmosphere.
Nice place and tasty pizza done on wood oven just fantastic!
Delicious Neapolitan style pizzas! I had the Cappricciosa and was very impressed!
The Rosemary Chicken sandwich with tomato basil soup was super delicious. The service was great. I love coming here. I always have a great experience.
Hard to find but amazing once you're inside! Possibly the best pizza I've ever had, and that's saying a lot
Great family friendly fun.  Always a kid favorite
Great place in downtown Boise.  Get a seat by the window if you can so you can traffic and people watch.
Yum
Unreal!  Great food, service, ambience!
Super bummed that the cookies are hard and cold - no longer warm and soft. Also, menu is tasty. Pizza is delicious. But options are limited so after eating here a few times, you've had it all.
Service was great! Love the decor in the restaurant!
Always a great experience. The staff are friendly and the food is excellent.
Delicious pizza and the flatbread is delicious!

That was my first time visiting.  I had a flat bread pizza that typically comes with brie, but I'm not a fan so they swapped in mozzarella for me.  It was fantastic.  They provided great service too.  I'll be back!
Test is good. but they have tosted the pizza little bit black Which I have not liked. Ambiance and location is perfect
This place is so yummy need I say more.
Kevin is da bomb
Jake made an amazing diavola, had a beautiful rose garnish, will definitely come back
Service is slow
I was a part of a large group that involved some adults who were high maintenance. The manager was more than accommodating and extremely friendly.

FIRST TIMERS--Stopped for a quick lunch!- IT WAS AMAZING! Great food, great ice cold beer, staff was very pleasant and efficient!  ** I  had the Roasted Chicken Portobello sandwich!! Got to visit with one of the senior management..Great guy! I've eaten at Many resturants over 34 years in the military, and I can tell you Boise is lucky to have this place!! CHECK IT OUT! Thanks guys! Great start to a great weekend! DT/ USAF
It was probably the best pizza I ever had
The pizza crust is nice and thin while not being too crunchy!

Perfect downtown lunch place. The pick-two menu gets you a lot of food for a decent price. Their pizzas are so great. I also love coming here for their happy hour. You get half price on all cocktails, wine glasses, and draft beers, plus cheap food! EDIT: They changed their happy hour special to a "thirsty thirty" and it now ends at 5:30 and is only 30% off drinks (which they raised prices on). i.am.so.sad. Going elsewhere now for happy hours.
Good food, good atmosphere, usually a nice selection of craft beer.
The salads were great
Really good pizza!
Was good but have had way better pizza. The service was great though!
Great food nice pleace
Varied, simple and quite tasty food and drink menu. Great service.
Great family atmosphere and environment.  Love the pizza and salads.
Great pizza.
The gluten free availability is extra great here. Don't hesitate!
Great food and service. Music was a bit loud.
Great food friendly staff
It was terrific!  Food was great and the service was awesome!

🌟Looked up top 10 Pizza Restraunt’s in Boise.  “Flat Bread Pizza”, Star-5 - Brick Oven Baked Pizza😍 Delicious!  Salad was great.  Service excellent😊 Oh and the warm Chocolate Chip Cookies, YES! From: Twin Falls, Idaho

We went there on Saturday night. The location is great. They have seats by the open wide windows facing 8th street which we enjoyed a lot. The environment was casual and friendly and there was an authentic pizza oven at the center. Pretty cool to me plus you couldn't smell any burning oil or smoke in there which is an issue for me at indoor busy restaurants. Our server was shaved head long bearded gentleman who gave us an extraordinary service. We ordered roasted tomatoes with goat cheese for appetizer which was one of the best appetizers I had so far! It is spicy hot as it should be! The pizza was authentic and taste delicious!the ingredients were fresh!  Do not expect anything like your usual Domino's pizza. This is different! If you feel like eating greasy salty pizza, don't go here this time! But if you feel like eating Italian pizza this is the place!
Consistently awesome flatbread and creative appetizers. Very friendly service.

Fire roasted tomatoes with goat cheese is the best appetizer here! Decent place downtown for lunch, dinner. Not entirely sure how but it's always very loud. Full or half empty its very noisy, hard to enjoy a good night out. Pizza is always floppy, very moist. It's impossible to pick up a slice and eat it nicely, everything slides off of it. Hopefully it improves. I still keep going back for the goat cheese.
The Osso Buco Ravioli were wonderful.  Surprisingly spicy hot but not over the top.  Good beer selection and friendly, accommodating staff to our group of 13.

Came in as a solo diner and thought the service was poor. Poor service is forgivable though, what’s not forgivable is running an oven at too low a temperature guaranteeing a floppy crust which is what I got.
Great food an views! Love the location the pizza is awesome an the drinks are pretty good!
Been coming here for years awesome location an great food service is always on spot!
One of the best pizza places in Boise!
Yummy
I had a gluten free crust. Possibly the best non-homemade GF crust I've had in years. (Caramalized fennel with sausage & portobello mushrooms)
Delicious food for a reasonable price. Just make sure to brush up on your Italian toppings names
Good happy hour. Nice menu options and 1/2 priced drinks.

Amazing food here. I have always loved this place. The one at Bowens Crossing is the first one I ever went to. Then Meridian and that one is my favorite still. I went to the downtown Boise and the atmosphere is amazing. The staff was so/so there though. Water took 15 minutes to get. It was warm outside and the small ice that was in the glass melted immediately. I prefer the Meridian one instead the staff is friendly and water is quick.
Went for a company lunch and loved everything.
They have a great late night happy hour on the weekends. Our server Spencer was awesome very attentive definitely ask for him .
Authentic, and delicious.

They have delightful food and drinks. I would suggest the pick 2. The macaroni and cheese is absolutely delicious, you can also pick pizzas or sandwichs. Everything is wonderful. The first time I went there my husband ordered it and I thought, why macaroni and cheese? Needless to say, I have ordered it ever since that day. I have never been disappointed there. The staff is very nice & service is great. Highly recommend.

What can i say?. The staff=AWESOME, the food=AWESOME, the atmosphere=perfect! The location=A+. We were looking, for someplace not so loud, but still busy, but was able to seat us. Everything was spot on. I really appreciate you guys for making this a great night. Keep up the great work.
Yum
Some of the most authentic Italian pizza I have ever had!
Yummy
Better than the one in meridian, if you live in meridian worth the drive, my favorite spot of happy hour, great lunch menu, staff is wonderful and can't go wrong with the food or cocktails!
Great place to grab lunch and the service is excellent!
I come here for lunch often. they have very good food and fast service.
Great authentic Italian pizza, holds up with the pizza I've had in Italy
This Flatbread Neapolitan Pizzerian is great. Nice and clean.
Great pizza, decent service, and fairly reasonable prices.

Went here for the very first time. The staff were WONDERFUL! Stopped in with no reservation before the lunch rush and since it was our first time they took us to a great view! Because we were first timers our waiter gave us the detailed low-down on what everything is in a professional friendly manner. My mother has sight problems and he was so very patient with her which I very much appreciated. My brother has social anxiety and speaks low when near many people, our waiter simply got closer and spoke to him, almost kinder I would like to say. I wish I remembered our hostess and waiters name!! Their selection of items was incredibly inclusive to those who are vegan, food allergies and of course our meat eaters! Food preparation was beautiful (not sure authentic because I'm not Italian nor know what the authentic dishes look like...) we definitely thought we didnt order enough food until we started eating! It was more than enough with left overs to take on the road! Keep up the amazing service and foods we will sure to be back!
Awesome tasting pizza!

Best Happy Hour! I think people forget about it since it's on the 2nd floor so it's not usually crowded, and they have a great view and the attached parking garage is so convenient. Their usual cocktails are great, and the seasonal ones are even better. And don't even get me started on the baked goat cheese! So good; I usually just have it as my dinner. Their staff is also so friendly and on-the-ball. I've never had a bad experience and I have been there more times than I will admit.
Food was delicious but customer service was poor.

They were able to provide us with a phenomenal vegan option. Wonderful atmosphere, friendly staff!!! Walk in and the most tantalizing aromas greet you. . . definitely going again next time I'm in the area.
Great
Almost friendly staff. Pretty indifferent attention but the Bianco Magnifico flatbread was off the charts. The kitchen has it goin on!
Came in for one drink and there was a hair stuck to my glass.i didn't notice it till my drink was almost gone,  What's up with the dish washer!!!
Great food

Great pizza place in downtown.  The restaurant is upstairs and has a good view down to the busy street below.  Nice wood burning pizza oven in the middle of the restaurant.  Also good to note there is a full bar as you enter.  I always love this style of pizza - for ease of description I would call it thin crust.
Good Food.  Good Service.
# great pizza

Great food and great ambiance. I love the decor of this location. Food is always good. I highly recommend the meatballs they are delicious. My husband and I always have a good experience here they never disappoint. Staff is always nice and friendly.
Had the test pizza of the month. Fantastic! Only thing I would change is the type of apple like a Gala apple. If you guys wanna hire a semi pro taste tester, I am all ears! :)
Great place for casual dining!
Love the steak tip dip! Always excellent.
overrated
Epic macaroni and cheese.  That is all.
Fabulous, as always!
Great food and even better service!
Nice atmosphere and unique menu. Really tasty and good service!
Good food, good service
Great location, middle way beer selection and decent food. It can get even better. Overcooked pasta and maybe they should turn down the volume a bit. For me lunch is chatting not yelling.

Flatbread is easily one of my favorite restaurants in idaho! My husband and I thoroughly enjoy our meals every visit! Even with their recent menu changes, we've been extremely happy with our experiences and food here!
Pizza about average, medicore service.
(Translated by Google) It was the most delicious pizza I had in America.  (Original) アメリカで食べたピザの中ではとてもおいしかったです。
95% great, gluten free crust needs a little work

This place is awesome. Their restaurant is  beautiful and inviting. All the staff seems happy and eager to help. They cook their pizza in a very cool looking wood-burning brick oven. The oven is the centrepiece of their tasteful decor.  It is right out in the open and you are able to watch your pizza be cooked to brick oven perfection.  My wife has been trying to get me go here for months and I am glad I finally did so. We will be back again and again!!!
Hard to find, but once we figure it was UPSTAIRS in an office bldg, pizza perfect thin crust, better than a variety toppings and beer great too
Great food, server needs to work on his craft.
Must try the cucumber sage cocktail, yum! Try to get a table by the window so you can look down on the bustling Boise streets.
Our hostess and bartender were amazing! Everything, from the food to the environment, was fantastic. Can't recommend it enough.
Always delicious and there specials are very reasonable!
Delicious pizza and great service!

Great food, authentic flatbread pizza and fresh ingredients. Also rocking a full bar. Location is also pretty awesome, indoors only upstairs with a great large window view of busy downtown 8th Street.

I thought it would be boring and typical of other pizza restaurants but was pleasantly surprised at the menu options. Even my kids loved it. The make your own pizza on the kids menu is truly make your own; my son spread his own sauce and added the toppings himself before it was cooked.  Delicious food!
Best pizza in Boise!
Excellent food and authentic neopolitan pizza. The service is friendly and you can watch your order being cooked in the brick oven
A go to place for my wife and I. It could be date night or the kids birthday, we always have great food and fun and friendly service.
Great food for the price
Decent food, pizza had burnt spots on the bottom. I'm just not a fan of tasting burned food.
It's decent.  Bummed that they always burn the GF crust.  Glad they offer GF though.
Go in for the bartenders Manhattan! Ask for Emily! Her cocktails are dynamite!!
Love this place, the service has always been A+
Super good pizza, salads, sides and a friendly staff. The pizza cook was even friendly enough to give me lessons on how to use the stone oven.
If you like the other one you'll like this one. They are exactly the same.

This place always has the best flatbreads and theres usually something new everytime I go in. The staff and cooks are amazing at catering to specific needs also. I highly recommend the lunch specials, great deals on amazing food!
This restaurant was great! Made a last minute reservation for 12 people on a Friday. They were so helpful. Great food and drinks. The staff was amazing!!! Thank you!!!
Great atmosphere and superb service
Delicious food, great place to sit down with friends!

Sadly my favorite pizza, the white truffle mushroom, has been removed from the menu, and I have yet to find a pizza that compares to it. I have been a regular at this place for years, for good reason. Their service is always perfect. The appetizers, drinks, and pizzas are perfect, and the location has perfect views of downtown Boise. Everything about this place is perfect. (except the empty spot on the menu where there used to be a truffle pizza)
Great service, great food!!!
nice place to go and eat
Nice variation of Italian food with a modern setup and cool location.

Friendly staff great place good service. The pic two lunch special is it a great deal. I'd suggest a pepperoni pizza and Porto Bello sandwich. But I did not much care for that Porto Bella Pizza with truffle oil

We had a little service issue and the customer service recovery was amazing. It's the true test of a restaurant when you can successfully recover a mistake. The food is always good and the servers are knowledgeable about the menu which I always appreciate. Thank you!
Not a big fan.. It's too expensive for the portion size (lasagna)
Best wings in Boise. No joke.
It's good, affordable, but portion for price is a little under for us.

We had lunch here, and it was great!  Their lunch special is perfect - we each had our choice of mini pizza and half salad.  I had the Alfredo the Grate pizza, and the Italian Wedge, and both were perfect.
Loved the wings and the pizza.

If you're looking for delicious pizza with a modern twist, then look no further! So yummy!! Yes the prices are a little high for pizza, but you're paying for the high quality ingredients! Totally worth it!
Good pizza, salads and Mac and cheese.  Service is always grear

My wife and I ordered some pizza and took it home with us so we never got to experience dining inside—it looked amazing inside! And the pizza was DELICIOUS! However, it was a little too expensive. Looking forward to going back one day.
One of our families favorite places!  Fast, friendly service.  Great happy hour specials.
Came in for a late bite to eat, Spencer our server was very knowledgeable and attentive. Will definitely be visiting again soon!
just skip don't waste your  nothing like pictures  tossed together greasy cheesy excuse of a pizza
Good atmosphere and quality pizza.  $10 Tuesday

Had a great time, food and beers really hit the spot. The pizza selection is fantastic, and I'd love to see some more risky varieties... Something that takes chances! Our server Brock was on top of it, attentive and super friendly. We all had an amazing time and I'll definitely be back time and time again. Would recommend.
Over priced and skimpy portions!  Do not recommend.  Service also sucked.  Teenage girls too busy gossiping to refill water and check on customers.  Extremely loud in there too.

We came here for lunch Alli was our server. The only reason for 3 starts instead of 2 is most of our food. She gave us warm water which she forgot to refill, I had to ask for a straw twice, didn't ask how our food was (gnocchi was luke warm). Worst of all is they weren't even busy
Sooo good!! Service was awesome, friendly and all the staff was super attentive and helpful.. one of my favorite places on 8th street. Will be back soon!

Less than average service here. Walked in and sat at the bar. Initial greeting from bartender did happen however we waited an additional 12 minutes and then some while she proceeded to check her phone, bs with another employee who had just arrived for work and didn't even return to acknowledge the rude behavior. The pay no mind attitude was very clear and I can't say I would be back since this was my first visit and it was a horrible first impression.
The food seemed extra salty.   Did not care for what we ordered.
Good food and service. Great location in the heart of Boise
Very good. Pizza is good could use more spice. Waiter is great. I recommend this pizza place in boise.
Nico was great!
Fairly good pizza. In Idaho, the choice is usually between Chicago-style or cheap New York by-the-slice pizza at three times the cost you'd pay in "The Big Apple". Flatbread offers an alternative.
Good lunch spot.
I got the lunch special and it was the perfect amount of food. The food was delicious and the service was great. They also have a great selection of wine.
My favorite place for pizza and they have the best salads in town.
Super annoying that the waitress is also the bartender. Makes the service store slow.  Get a bartender.

We've always enjoyed this in the past, especially when they first opened and only had the one location. Unfortunately our dinner at their Zions bank location was disappointing and I certainly expected more out of them. Their signature D.O.C. NEAPOLITAN pizza was so soggy it was impossible to pick it up and it forced me to "Trump" it and use a fork.  In addition service was spotty, as we had to continually ask for more water and were never asked if we would like any refills on other beverages. An unfortunate end to a great day at the Festival of Trees.

On a road trip passing through Boise where I️ lived 35 years ago, and looking for a good salad and thin crust pizza—this was a great choice! Highly highly recommend the wedge salad with spicy sweet bacon and Gorgonzola. Perfect paired with four cheese pizza. Tangy tomato sauce and high quality cheese. Rustic chic ambiance—stacks of wood piled high at the ready stoking the pizza oven.
Pick 2 is off the hook..... problem is it ends at 4pm . Still love this place !
Excellent food! Maddie was our server. She was fun, fast and knowledgeable. We'll be back again.
Food was good, atmosphere was hip, but service was slow.
Go for Sat. breakfast!!! It's soooo good! Their sweet and savory dishes are both so good!

If you are gluten free they offer the option to have their pizza's made gluten free. This is fantastic as many other local places do not do this. And if you like spicy you have to get their spicy sauce to drizzle on your pizza!
Great recipe and service
Excellent food and cocktails with an eye for uniqueness and quality.
Disappointed that they don't offer senior citizen portions. Ordered a half salad and soup rather than an entree. It was very good.
Great food. Try and get a seat next to the windows for a great view of the street below!
Very friendly staff and the pizza was great. Never had flatbread pizza until I tried it here.
Best pie in Boise
Always love coming here. Wonderful food and people.
Great happy hour. Can get a great happy hour dinner under $25 for 2.
Good food and drinks in a unique environment.
Fantastic food. Beer choices are limited and VERY expensive as us their food. But the food is wonderful and a great view over-looking 8th Street
Try the Mac and cheese

8th and Main is a new building and the interior is nice.  A chain restaurant.  Good place to have a family outing, date, group, or celebration.  The staff are friendly and helpful.  Can be a crowd in the entry/waiting and you should make a reservation or plan on waiting a bit on weekend nights.  Food is good.  They have a bar.
Awesome, authentic Italian pizza!
Better Italian in downtown Boise
My favorite restaurant. The goat cheese appetizer is the best!
Bring back my meatball sandwhich
Amazing tasty pizzas
Great authentic neopolitan pizza
I know it's a chain but high quality pizza and hot sandwiches! Lovely downtown views.
Location and environment is super classy and fun. The food is great but I personally feel that their regular pizzas could be much better. On the other hand, the flatbread pizzas are amazing!
Delicious pizza, friendly staff, and great view from downtown. Ideal for a lunch date.
Nice atmosphere, I really enjoyed my beer flight and the pizza my wife an i shared was tasty.

Delicious food!  The wait staff is wonderful - helpful with suggestions, friendly, attending to every need.  Great lunch specials. They have flatbreads but also some great salads. The fresh hot cookies with ICE cold milk-  gotta haves!!
Good atmosphere and friendly service, also with a bar to watch any games. Try the Margherita or Truffle Pizza and chopped Kale salad.
Loud. Pizza selections and flatbread weren't that extensive and loaded with toppings. Not really neapolatin style. Would have like minimalistic pizza. And more options.

The food at Flatbread is very good.  I can not deny that.  But what you get foe the price and quality of service makes it a hard meal choice.  The best time to get their great food at a reasonable price is during happy hour.  M-F 4-6 and Weekends 9-close.  So, it is a great place for a snack and a drink right after work.  The service at the downtown location has also seemed to slip every since moving into the new building.  I highly recommend it for their food but be prepared to drop some coin and be patient.
Best pizza in town
Nice location, good food, a little pricy.
Really awesome pizza and drinks. We love it.
Great food and good beer selection. Can be busy though.
Good pizza place. Not 5 star but 4 star pizza
Good food and great happy hour. The pizzas are delicious and unique.
Excellent food, and friendly servers. Highly recommend.

Excellent food, modern but casual atmosphere, friendly and helpful staff. We had a fondue appetizer that tasted nothing like good fondue, but I loved it anyway. The pizzas were tasty and had generous toppings, but were a bit pricey. Size was too large for one but not enough for two. The view from the second floor windows of downtown Boise is pleasant and provided a perfect setting for our group of six.
Awesome pizza. Perfectly thin and creative toppings.
Kids had a great time, order a pizza off the kids menu and they can make it themselves. Food was above average.
Our fave Boise stop!
Excellent service and great food! An awesome ambience with huge windows to look down at the city from. Repeat customer!!! Highly recommend!
One of my favorite Boise restaurants. Fantastic pizza
Pretty good
Waiter was nice and helpful!
Great pizza, but pricey.

I can't say enough about Flatbread. The atmosphere is nice, but still casual. The food is delicious, and the drinks are good. It's great for one or two people to have a quick lunch, or for large groups to eat and socialize. It is my go-to restaurant for both celebratory events with larger groups (i.e. birthdays and graduation) or for those "Where do you want to eat," "I don't care, where do you want to go," types of meals. I am vegetarian and always have a lot of options, and they are happy to substitute meat for something else as well. Also the assistant manager Caitlin is awesome and super friendly!
My favorite pizza shop in Boise. High quality traditional Italian style pizza. Mmm
Loved it.  Great food with nice atmosphere.
Pizza with many traditional choices at a decent price. Check out their Tuesday pizza specials.

Hosted a birthday party here. Really nice view of Boise! Really tasty pizza. Waitress was cordial. Will come back again soon for more bbq chicken pizza.  Not a good idea if you're on a college budget only because... The prices are fair, but everything is so delicious you'll want to try and buy more!
Brick oven pizza hut in a new building in the downtown Boise area. Great food and great value.

We've eaten at Flatbread quite a few times, going back to their original location downtown.  Always had enjoyed the food and the funky-friendly vibe.  The new location is not as warm, or inviting, but it seemed to still be friendly enough, and we have really liked the food.  So, we've continued to go, but recently our experience wasn't as enjoyable.  Our server was either having a horrible rotten day, or we did something to offend him.  We may have gotten off on the wrong foot, when we ordered hot tea, and asked what kinds of tea they had---so he brought a small carrier to the table with several tea bags, and then left not to be seen again for 10 minutes or so.  When he finally appeared again, we asked him if we could have some hot water to put the tea IN. With evident exasperation, he said he'd been waiting (really? where?) for us to pick which of the tea bags we wanted to use.  Hmm.  Then, after our two pizzas were brought to the table (and summarily dropped without a word), we noticed something.  One of the specialty pies we'd ordered was missing one of the meat toppings. The server was long gone, of course, but we managed to flag him down, and ask about the missing topping.  He simply said, "You're wrong, it's there" ---arguing with us and practically poking his finger in the pizza, apparently in the belief that if he was emphatic enough we would shut up.  When that didn't work, he grabbed the plate and left, saying he would put the topping on (whether we wanted it that way or not, apparently).  We weren't sure what he was going to do.  But then he brought the plate back with the (cold) topping flopped down onto the pizza.  Well.  That was interesting. Later, a manager came over, knelt down so her face was barely a foot away from us, and started chatting with us about how the person in the kitchen whose job it was to put the topping onto the pie had in fact screwed up and hadn't put it on. She apologized, but kindly pointed out that the particular topping in question goes onto the pizza AFTER baking, so the fact that the server had tossed it on midway through our meal shouldn't have mattered.  (Ok. Well, if that was the case, and the pie wasn't supposed to have this topping until AFTER being cooked, why did the server argue with us and try to convince us the cooked pizza actually DID have the missing ingredient?)  So.  If you judge a restaurant solely by the quality of the food, this probably could--or should--be a four or five-star review.  The food at FlatBread is good. But there's lots of places that have good food.  What sets a restaurant apart (especially one which charges about $20 per entree) is the quality of the experience.  So, this particular night left us thinking we might try somewhere else next time.  But I will also say that the manager did make a deduction on our ticket, for half the cost of the pizza in question.  That was much appreciated, and pulls this review up from a "two-star" to a "three-star".
